senses.sense_definition: To make something spiritual, pure, or intellectually refined, often by removing material or corrupting influences.

examples.text: Meditation is often used to <w>spiritualize</w> the mind and detach it from daily worries.
The artist sought to <w>spiritualize</w> nature in his paintings, focusing on its divine essence rather than physical details.

senses.sense_definition: To interpret a text, event, or concept in a spiritual or symbolic way rather than a literal one.

examples.text: Some theologians tend to <w>spiritualize</w> biblical passages that others take literally.
It is common to <w>spiritualize</w> ancient myths to find deeper moral truths within them.

senses.sense_definition: To convert a substance into a volatile spirit or vapor, or to extract its essence.

examples.text: The alchemist attempted to <w>spiritualize</w> the metal through intense heat and distillation.
In early chemistry, practitioners would <w>spiritualize</w> liquids to capture their purest form.
